com.metreeca.rdf4j.services

Class GraphEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.metreeca.rdf4j.services.GraphEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Engine

    public final class GraphEngine
extends Object
implements Engine
    Model-driven graph engine.

    Manages graph transactions and handles model-driven CRUD actions on LDP resources stored in the shared graph.

    See Also:
    Linked Data Platform 1.0

    • Method Detail

      • exec

        public <R> R exec(Supplier<R> task)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Executes a task within a storage transaction.

        If a transaction is not already active on the underlying storage, begins one and commits it on successful task completion; if the task throws an exception, the transaction is rolled back and the exception rethrown; in either case, no action is taken if the transaction was already terminated inside the task.

        Falls back to plain task execution if transactions are not supported by this engine.

        Specified by:
        exec in interface Engine
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the value returned by the task
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be executed
        Returns:
        the value returned by task

      • trim

        public <M extends Message<M>> Result<M,Failure> trim(M message)
        Description copied from interface: Engine
        Trims message payloads.

        Rewrites the engine-specific message payload retaining only the subset compatible with the envelope of the message shape.

        Specified by:
        trim in interface Engine
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message whose engine-specific payload is to be trimmed
        Returns:
        a value providing access to the given message with an updated payload, if its engine-specific payload is well-formed and compatible with its shape; an error providing access to a failure possibly containing a validation trace, otherwise

      • create

        public Future<Response> create(Request request)
        Creates an LDP resource.

        Handles creation requests on the linked data container identified by the request focus item, according to the following operating modes.

        If the request target is a collection:

        • the request is expected to include a member resource shape;
        • the request RDF body is expected to contain an RDF description of the resource to be created matched by the shape using the request item as subject;
        • the resource to be created is assigned a unique IRI based on the stem of the the request IRI and the value of the Slug request header, if one is found, or a random UUID, otherwise;
        • the request RDF body is rewritten to the assigned IRI and stored into the shared graph ;
        • the target container identified by the request item is connected to the newly created resource as required by the LDP container profile identified by the filtering constraints in the request shape;
        • the operation is completed with a status code;
        • the IRI of the newly created resource is advertised through the Location HTTP response header.

        Otherwise:

        • the request is reported with a Response.InternalServerError status code.
        Specified by:
        create in interface Engine
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be handled
        Returns:
        a lazy response generated for the managed linked data resource in reaction to request
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null

      • relate

        public Future<Response> relate(Request request)
        Retrieves an LDP resource.

        Handles retrieval requests on the linked data resource identified by the request focus item, according to the following operating modes.

        If the focus item is a collection:

        • the request is expected to include a combined container/member shape;
        • the response includes the derived shape actually used in the retrieval process;
        • the response RDF body includes the RDF description of the container as matched by the Shape.Holder area of request shape, linked using the ldp:contains property to the RDF description of the resources matched by the filtering constrains of the Shape.Digest area of the request shape;
        • Shape.Digest area of the request shape doesn't contain any filtering constrains, member resources explicitely to linked to the target container using the ldp:contains property are included;
        • if the request contains a filtering query, only matching container members descriptions are included.
        • if the request contains a Prefer header requesting the ldp:preferMinimalContainer representation, member descriptions are omitted;
        • the operation is completed with a status code.

        Otherwise, if the shared graph actually contains a resource matching the request item IRI:

        • the request is expected to include a member resource shape;
        • the response includes the derived shape actually used in the retrieval process;
        • the response RDF body contains the RDF description of the request item, as matched by the request request shape;
        • the operation is completed with a status code.

        Otherwise:

        • the operation is reported as unsuccessful with a status code.

        Regardless of the operating mode, RDF data is retrieved from the shared graph.

        Specified by:
        relate in interface Engine
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be handled
        Returns:
        a lazy response generated for the managed linked data resource in reaction to request
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null

      • update

        public Future<Response> update(Request request)
        Updates an LDP resource.

        Handles updating requests on the linked data resource identified by the request item, according to the following operating modes.

        If the request target is a collection:

        • the request is reported with a Response.InternalServerError status code.

        Otherwise, if the shared graph actually contains a resource matching the request item IRI:

        • the request is expected to include a member resource shape;
        • the request RDF body is expected to contain an RDF description of the resource to be updated matched by the shape;
        • the existing RDF description of the target resource matched by the request shape is replaced in the shared graph with the request RDF body;
        • the operation is completed with a status code.

        Otherwise:

        • the operation is reported with a status code.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Engine
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be handled
        Returns:
        a lazy response generated for the managed linked data resource in reaction to request
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null

      • delete

        public Future<Response> delete(Request request)
        Deletes an LDP resource.

        Handles deletion requests on the linked data resource identified by the request item, according to the following operating modes.

        If the request target is a collection:

        • the request is reported with a Response.InternalServerError status code.

        Otherwise, if the shared graph actually contains a resource matching the request item IRI:

        • the request is expected to include a member resource shape;
        • the existing RDF description of the target resource matched by the request shape is removed from the shared graph;
        • the operation is completed with a status code.

        Otherwise:

        • the operation is reported with a status code.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface Engine
        Parameters:
        request - the request to be handled
        Returns:
        a lazy response generated for the managed linked data resource in reaction to request
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if request is null
